result.markdown:
--- title: "KIND network update" format: html editor_options: chunk_output_type: console execute: echo: false message: false --- ```{=html} ``` ## Week beginning Mon 17th March 2025 Dear colleagues, I'm pleased to announce that we've now got the beginnings of a schedule for Power Automate week, which can be found below. I'd also like to announce another week of dates to save: **Save another date** - data literacy week, 14th April to 17th April 2025. That'll be (almost) a week dedicated to sessions about core data skills and knowledge. More information on that over the coming weeks. Brendan --- ## Power Automate week plan We're running a network-wide [Microsoft Power Automate](https://www.microsoft.com/en-gb/power-platform/products/power-automate) week between 31st March and 4th April. The current iteration of that plan includes: ### Training sessions + [Scope of the possible with Power Automate](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/097b9b2e-29c7-4140-ba0f-b4adc419d9e1@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Monday 31st March 10.00-11.00 + [Introduction to Power Automate](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/69591eaf-5246-409d-ba71-2d11266e083e@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Monday 31st March 15.00-16.00 + [Conditions in Power Automate](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/70a5bee4-7bec-48e3-bffb-fbb0815554ad@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Tuesday 1st April 13.30-15.30 + [Mailing lists in Power Automate](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/020db29d-bf5d-4018-b2a4-0d95f1878ed4@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Wednesday 2nd April 14.00-16.00 ### Support group Sessions for mutual aid, sharing best practice, and ideas to support Power Automate projects. These are level-based, so over the week you can register for: + ["I've never built a flow"](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/9901a287-c34f-4c98-8b44-e1db8923a830@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Tuesday 1st April 10.00-11.00 + ["I'm a beginner"](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/2889a142-c9e8-494d-b874-1bc3e17c66ef@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Wednesday 2nd April 11.00-12.00 + ["I'm beyond the beginner-level"](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/89c69240-ffef-40f8-9550-bae3b8078337@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) - Thursday 3rd April 11.30-12.30 ### Project presentations Presentations from members of the network. There are more to come of these, and please get in touch if you'd like to show your Power Automate work - it definitely doesn't need to be elaborate or fancy to be important and interesting. + [Pauline Russell (NSS) - customer supply notification process using Excel, and potentially something else...](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/8b6622f1-7bd1-4523-bc99-1f9dcc140c00@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a), Thursday 3rd April 10.00-11.00 + [Kirstin Crawford (NES) - DLP signup process](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/ff0fc672-0301-45bb-81e1-77bf38103689@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a), Thursday 3rd April 13.00-14.00 + [Duncan Sage (PHS) - List workplans](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/7822afa9-38b0-43b0-907a-55b43a59f067@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a), Friday 4th April 13.00-14.00 --- ## Wins of The Week In the spirit of [#IAmRemarkable](https://www.rmrkblty.org/iamremarkable), we do a weekly wins of the week thread to celebrate the professional (and personal) achievements of the community: + Discovered the Spreadsheet Compare Tool which was a revelation! + A Friday win - combining multiple Excel Worksheets into a single worksheet with Power Query. I did need a YouTube video to set me on the right path though :) + Getting to grips with my job role after a period of illness. Although i know I should do this, I have to remind myself to take breaks. I even put an alarm on! + Despite being a ridiculously busy week and getting pulled in a million different directions, I've somehow managed to keep on top of everything, and gotten so much done! (had a minor goof today though, been rushing to get work done before a meeting "this afternoon," but uh... turns out it's next week ðŸ¤£ (so relieved for the extra week, not gonna lie!)) Well done all, and looking forward to [hearing your wins of the week](https://forms.office.com/e/8DgpNP6rcK) in future. --- ## Training sessions Click the link to book yourself into the session. `````{=html}
Session Date Area Level
Pivot tables and pivot charts 13:00-14:30 Wed 19th March 2025 Excel ðŸŒ¶ðŸŒ¶: intermediate-level
````` ## Forthcoming events + the next SCODAS meeting is an update on the proposed [DDaT](https://www.gov.scot/policies/digital/digital-data-technology-profession/) NHS Boards pilot by Alan Milbourne (Scottish Government) and Paula Baird (NES). Tuesday 18th March 1.00-2.00pm - [SCODAS Teams joining link](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/team/19%3A40ba3985b4be4ea5850c4350dab12e6e%40thread.tacv2/conversations?groupId=3603c513-27b3-4918-a31a-03f63131b486&tenantId=10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) + Glasgow Caledonian University are coming to the KIND network to update on their AI and Data Science BSc apprenticeship programme. Wednesday 19th March 3.00-4.00pm - [registration link](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/49ba4572-9856-4a10-b92d-dd2f9d9095e1@10efe0bd-a030-4bca-809c-b5e6745e499a) + NES Knowledge Services are running another of their excellent lunch and learn sessions - getting the best from your digital library account. Tuesday 25th March 1.00-1.45pm - [registration link](https://learn.nes.nhs.scot/80989) [Unsubscribe from these emails](https://forms.office.com/r/t97cZDiw7y)
